## Machine Learning – definition

A type of artificial intelligence in which computers use huge amounts of data to learn how to do tasks rather than being programmed to do them.

<br>

Machine learning makes it possible for computing systems to become smarter as they encounter additional data.

## Machine Learning – types {#blue_dash transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

::: incremental
-    Supervised machine learning

    -   Data with labels – learn the mapping between input and output.

-    Unupervised machine learning

    -   Data without labels – learn patterns in the dataset.

-    Reinforcement machine learning

    -   Feedback-based learning – actions are rewarded or punished.
:::

## Machine learning statistics

::: {.columns .m-0}
::: {.column .is-half .m-0}
::: {.is-size-4 .has-text-centered .is-vcentered}

<p>
Confusion Matrix
</p>

|                     | Predicted Positive                                                     | Predicted Negative                                                     |
|---------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Actual Positive** | [TP]{.is-size-3 .is-family-code style="color:blue; font-weight: 700;"} | [FN]{.is-size-3 .is-family-code style="color:blue; font-weight: 700;"} |
| **Actual Negative** | [FP]{.is-size-3 .is-family-code style="color:blue; font-weight: 700;"} | [TN]{.is-size-3 .is-family-code style="color:blue; font-weight: 700;"} |

::: {.is-size-5 .fragment .mt-6 .pt-6 .has-text-left}
Sensitivity ↔ True Positive Rate ↔ Recall

Specificity ↔ True Negative Rate

Precision ↔ Positive Predictive Value
:::
:::
:::

::: {.column .is-half .fragment .m-0 data-fragment-index="1"}
$$
Sensitivity = \frac{TP}{TP+FN} 
$$ $$
Specificity = \frac{TN}{TN+FP}
$$ $$
Precision = \frac{TP}{TP + FP}
$$

$$
FPR = \frac{FP}{TN + FP} = 1 - specificity
$$

$$
Accuracy = \frac{TP +TN}{TP +TN +FP +FN}
$$

$$
Error \text{ } rate = \frac{FP +FN}{TP + TN+ FP + FN}
$$
:::
:::
